titlepage.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Alexis V. Lapteff Papers, 1921-1971
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Memoirs, reports, and photographs, relating to relief work in the Ufa-Urals district.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alexis V. Lapteff papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1970.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

did.unittitle: Protection Report, based on physical inventory of food stock, 1923 April 1
Adult Feeding Table, Corn Issue, 1922 March-September
Document issued to Colonel Bell by the Plenipotentiary Representative of RSFSR giving him the right of direct wire communications in the region, No. 1101, 1922 May 4 (in Russian)
Address in the form of a manuscript presented to Colonel Bell from the Russian employees of the ARA (in Russian and English)
Letter to A. V. Lapteff by the ARA, Colonel Bell, 1923 June 25
ARA staff in front of the first ARA office in Ufa, winter of 1921-1922
Children and members of ARA in front of one of Ufa ARA "kitchens," 1921-1923
ARA Ufa office building on Pushkin Street, 1922-1923
Colonel Bell at his desk in Ufa office, with Messrs Howard, Murphy, and Verdon
Mr. La Salle, Colonel Bell, and Mr. Lykes in Ufa. Colonel Bell and Mr. Lykes wearing the tartar tibiteykas
Mr. Blandy in front of sleigh on Ufa street, 1922
Inside of children's home, somewhere in Ufa region, 1922-1923
Well-to-do bashkir (or a tartar?) with his two wives and children, 1923
Photocopy of page 14 of A.R.A. Association Review, 1941 January
